item.title: Open Source VHDL Verification Methodology (OSVVM)
item.description: “OSVVM is an advanced verification methodology that defines a VHDL verification framework, verification utility library, verification component library, and a scripting flow that simplifies your FPGA or ASIC verification project from start to finish. Using these libraries you can create a simple, readable, and powerful testbench that is suitable for either a simple FPGA block or a complex ASIC."

item.title: SVUnit
item.description: “SVUnit is an open-source test framework for ASIC and FPGA developers writing Verilog/SystemVerilog code. SVUnit is automated, fast, lightweight and easy to use making it the only SystemVerilog test framework in existence suited to both design and verification engineers that aspire to high quality code and low bug rates."

item.title: Universal VHDL Verification Methodology (UVVM)
item.description: “Open Source VHDL Verification Library and Methodology - for very efficient VHDL verification of FPGA and ASIC - resulting also in a significant quality improvement”

item.title: VUnit
item.description: “VUnit is an open source unit testing framework for VHDL/SystemVerilog […] It features the functionality needed to realize continuous and automated testing of your HDL code. VUnit doesn’t replace but rather complements traditional testing methodologies by supporting a “test early and often” approach through automation."
